title: Everything You Need to Know About Mars in Cancer Women

steps.title: Mars in Cancer women are emotional, caring, and intuitive.
steps.content: Mars in Cancer women are emotional, caring, and intuitive. Mars is the planet of action, aggression, and desire in astrology, while Cancer is a water sign associated with gentleness and emotional sensitivity. The brash energy of Mars tends to be softened by the influence of Cancer, so Mars in Cancer women often have motivations and values driven by Cancer’s energy. They’re nurturing, kind, and fiercely protective of others (but may be more passive when it comes to expressing their own emotions). [1] X Research source Mars in Cancer women are often driven to build a home for themselves. They want comfort, security, and peace above all else; for them, home is a space where they can feel safe. Cancer is ruled by the Moon, the planet of emotions, subconscious feelings, and memories.

steps.title: Sensitive
steps.content: Sensitive Cancer is a water sign, and like all water signs, they’re highly intuitive and empathetic. Thus, Mars in Cancer women often have Cancer’s sensitivity; they can pick up on other people’s emotions (and, at times, lose themselves in the feelings of the people around them). This makes Mars in Cancer women incredibly compassionate and understanding people. [2] X Research source A Mars in Cancer woman may get overwhelmed by other peoples’ negative emotions because she’s so empathetic. If you’re a Mars in Cancer woman, practice separating your emotions from others when you feel overwhelmed. Figure out which feelings are your own and what you’re picking up from the people around you.

steps.title: Nurturing
steps.content: Nurturing Cancer is a deeply nurturing zodiac sign, which means Mars in Cancer women tend to be super caring toward their friends, family, and loved ones. They enjoy devoting time and energy to helping others and genuinely want to improve the lives of those around them. Because they’re so sensitive, Mars in Cancer women often know when someone is hurting and do their utmost to fix it. [3] X Research source If you’re a Mars in Cancer woman, remember to take time for yourself, too. Relax and practice self-care to release the stress you’re carrying.

steps.title: Protective
steps.content: Protective Mars in Cancer ladies are protective, both of themselves and of the people they care about. They can appear reserved around others because they have a self-protective shell and don’t like to reveal too much until they’re comfortable. When it comes to friends and family, however, Mars in Cancer women will react swiftly and fiercely defend them if they feel it’s necessary. A Mars in Cancer woman’s home usually reflects her protective nature; to her, home is the ultimate sanctuary, and she’ll invest tons of effort into making her home comfy and inviting.

steps.title: Methodical
steps.content: Methodical Routine is comforting to Mars in Cancer women; change doesn’t come easily to them, and they much prefer a life that feels stable and comfortable. They’re creatures of habit, sticking to what they know they like (and they’re definitely homebodies). Though Mars in Cancer women often have plenty of interests and may switch from one to another based on their mood, their daily rituals generally stay the same. [4] X Research source If you’re a Mars in Cancer woman, try keeping a planner (or at least a monthly calendar) to satisfy your need for organization and routine. Nonetheless, remember that a bit of spontaneity isn’t a bad thing! Don’t be afraid to try something new every once in a while or go on a spur-of-the-moment adventure for the fun of it.

steps.title: Tenacious
steps.content: Tenacious Though they can be passive and gentle, Mars in Cancer ladies certainly aren’t weak. Cancer is a cardinal sign, meaning they’re initiators and go-getters. Cardinal signs tend to be full of ideas and eager to put them into action, and Cancer is no exception, which is why Mars in Cancer women are surprisingly tenacious. When they’re passionate about something, they go for it—nothing can get in their way.

steps.title: Passive-aggressive
steps.content: Passive-aggressive Mars in Cancer women don’t like expressing overt anger and tend to avoid confrontation, but that means they have a habit of bottling up negative emotions, which can cause them to be moody (or defensive) when they're upset. A Mars in Cancer’s mood swings can be sudden when they harbor resentment, and they may become passive-aggressive when they don’t get their way. [5] X Research source If you’re a Mars in Cancer woman, remind yourself that suppressing your anger (and other negative emotions) isn’t healthy or productive. Practice expressing your emotions constructively instead. Mars in Cancer women may also be a little indecisive, but that doesn’t mean they want other people to decide for them. They prefer figuring things out together (and listening to soft suggestions, so long as they’re not too demanding).

steps.title: Imaginative
steps.content: Imaginative When the real world gets too overwhelming, dreams and imagination are always comforting for Mars in Cancer women. Since they may struggle to express themselves out loud, they use creativity and fantasy to work through their emotions—though, at times, it may seem like they’re lost in their own little world. Still, Mars in Cancer women tend to have a charming, creative whimsy and love artistic activities.

steps.title: Mars in Cancer women may be well-suited to caretaking or creative jobs.
steps.content: Mars in Cancer women may be well-suited to caretaking or creative jobs. Since they’re natural nurturers, a profession that lets them care for others—like nursing, counseling, or teaching—might appeal to a Mars in Cancer woman. In fact, some Mars in Cancers don’t feel like developing a career and prefer to focus on starting a family instead. Alternatively, since they’re creative, an artistic career (like design or illustration, for example) might fit some Mars in Cancer women. Mars in Cancer women are also protective and eager to stand up to injustice. They may find their calling in a career path that lets them help others, like social work or law.

steps.title: Mars in Cancer women generally prefer not to make the first move.
steps.content: Mars in Cancer women generally prefer not to make the first move. Because Cancer tends to be a more passive sign, Mars in Cancer women rarely want to make the first move when interested in someone (although they enjoy the fun of the chase). If they decide to “go after” someone, they’ll usually do it indirectly by spending more time with them and being especially sweet, compassionate, and nurturing. [6] X Research source If you’re interested in a Mars in Cancer woman, be bold and tell her how you feel ! If she likes you, she’s definitely waiting for you to take the first step.

steps.title: Emotional security is vital for Mars in Cancer ladies in relationships.
steps.content: Emotional security is vital for Mars in Cancer ladies in relationships. The most attractive partner for Mars in Cancer women is someone steady, supportive, and understanding; in short, someone who’ll protect their emotional well-being. Mars in Cancer women just want to feel emotionally secure with the person they love, so they look for partners who are compassionate and eager to care for them. [7] X Research source If you have eyes for a Mars in Cancer woman, focus on building an emotional connection first since it’s the most critical part of a relationship for her. Mars in Cancer women also don’t like doing things alone. They may ask their partner to tag along on an outing or help them with something—not because they can’t do it, but because they simply like having someone else there.

steps.title: Mars in Cancer women are family-oriented and want committed partners.
steps.content: Mars in Cancer women are family-oriented and want committed partners. Loyalty and commitment are a must for Mars in Cancer women; they rarely look for short-term flings. They’re looking for a partner they can settle down and build a home with, someone who’ll commit to them wholeheartedly and give them all the affection and care they crave. [8] X Research source If you’re interested in a Mars in Cancer woman, ensure you’re both on the same page about expectations for the relationship and that you’re ready for commitment—since that’s likely what she’s looking for.

steps.title: Cancer Mars women are most compatible with Mars in water or earth signs.
steps.content: Cancer Mars women are most compatible with Mars in water or earth signs. Astrologically, other water sign Mars placements (like Pisces and Scorpio) and earth sign Mars placements (including Taurus, Virgo, and Capricorn) tend to be the best match. Mars in Pisces and Scorpio sign placements can easily give a Mars in Cancer woman the emotional connection she craves. Meanwhile, Mars in Virgo, Taurus, and Capricorn are loyal, stable, and family-oriented sign placements (like Mars in Cancer). Cancer Mars women are particularly compatible with Scorpios because they both desire long-term, deeply emotional and stable relationships. A Scorpio is unlikely to lead on a romantic interest or prioritize a fling over something serious. Reader Poll: We asked 706 wikiHow readers who are Scorpios and only 5% of them said that they mainly look for totally casual and strictly physical relationships. [Take Poll]

steps.title: Mars in Cancer men are perceptive, kind, and generous.
steps.content: Mars in Cancer men are perceptive, kind, and generous. Like Mars in Cancer women, these men are deeply emotional and have big hearts; they love to help others and are extremely protective. They can intuitively sense the emotions of the people around them and often attract partners by demonstrating their keen emotional sensitivity. Mars in Cancer men love caring for their partners, and in turn, they look for partners who can support them emotionally. Mars in Cancer men are also very honest and genuine; they love giving thoughtful advice to help their loved ones grow and flourish. At the end of the day, Mars in Cancer men have many of the same traits as Mars in Cancer women (since both share traits related to the empathetic and sensitive water sign, Cancer).
